qas.question: As of May 2014, what was Robert Patton's job title?
What state employed Robert Patton in May 2014?
What was Clayton Lockett's cause of death?
What gas did Oklahoma decide to use for executions in 2015?
As of May 2011, what was Robert Patton's job title?
What state executed Robert Patton in May 2014?
What gas did Oklahoma decide to use for freedoms in 2015?

context: In May 2014, <a1_0><b6_0>Oklahoma<b6_0/><a1_0/> <a0_0><b5_0>Director of Corrections<b5_0/><a0_0/>, Robert Patton, recommended an indefinite hold on executions in the state after the botched execution of <a2_0><b7_0>African-American<b7_0/><a2_0/> Clayton Lockett. The prisoner had to be tasered to restrain him prior to the execution, and the lethal injection missed a vein in his groin, resulting in Lockett regaining consciousness, trying to get up, and to speak, before dying of a <a3_0><b8_0>heart attack<b8_0/><a3_0/> 43 minutes later, after the attempted execution had been called off. In 2015, the state approved <a4_0><b9_0>nitrogen<b9_0/><a4_0/> asphyxiation as a method of execution.
